description: The round payoff this round was 92. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 46.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual and joint payoffs
Mutual defection (both choosing option 2) results in significantly lower payoffs (≈15.33 each for a 92 payoff), incentivizing coordination on option 1.
Unilateral defection (choosing option 2 when the other chooses 1) harms the cooperator but yields less for the defector (≈30.67) than mutual cooperation, reducing temptation to defect.
The game structure resembles a coordination game with two Nash equilibria (mutual 1 and mutual 2), but mutual 1 is Pareto optimal.
